greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The rational numbers can be ordered by height and then by magnitude (see A002246, A097080); sequence gives numerators.
reference: M. N. Huxley, Area, Lattice Points and Exponential Sums, Oxford, 1996; p. 7.
link: Index entries for sequences related to enumerating the rationals
example: The rationals with this ordering, with those of height k in row k (there are three of height 1, and 4*A000010(k) rationals of height k, for k>1):
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 02 2008
ext: More terms from _John W. Layman_, Nov 06 2008
